title: Unlocking the future of homeownership: Gamuda Land’s Game-Changing GL Connect Portal
summary: Navigating the complexities of purchasing a home can be daunting, whether you are a first-time buyer or a seasoned home purchaser, with the myriad choices and decisions to make. title: 140 Years and Beyond with Malaysia
summary: It was a momentous occasion for HSBC as we commemorated our 140-year anniversary in Malaysia with distinguished guests, including YAB Dato' Seri Anwar bin Ibrahim, the Prime Minister of Malaysia. title: All that glitters is in fact gold for newlyweds

content:
FILE PHOTO: A gold ingot and gold coins are seen in this illustration picture taken November 17, 2017. REUTERS/Eric Gaillard/Illustration/File Photo

Beijing: Gold rings, earrings and necklaces have always been the go-to trio for traditional Chinese weddings.

However, breaking away from tradition, Zhou Xiao and his wife are turning heads by considering gold bars for their upcoming wedding.

title: China home sales rise after stimulus measures
summary: BEIJING: China’s home sales rose during the National Day holiday after a string of property stimulus measures to boost the country’s beleaguered real estate market since late September, state media says.
content:
— AFP

BEIJING: China’s home sales rose during the National Day holiday after a string of property stimulus measures to boost the country’s beleaguered real estate market since late September, state media says.

Across the world’s second-largest economy, policies including reductions in down-payment ratios and mortgage rates have been introduced this year to support the property sector, which previously made up one-quarter of economic activity.

content:

summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Pestech International Bhd (Pestech) has entered into a conditional subscription agreement with Dhaya Maju Infrastructure (Asia) Sdn Bhd (DMIA) for the proposed restricted issuance of the company’s shares worth RM160 million.

title: Sidec's Malaysia Semiconductor Recruitment Day 2024 attracts 2,000 job-seekers
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia Semiconductor Recruitment Day 2024, an event to match job-seekers with jobs in semiconductor companies, connected over 2,000 with over 25 companies during the two-day event.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Malaysia Semiconductor Recruitment Day 2024, an event to match job-seekers with jobs in semiconductor companies, connected over 2,000 with over 25 companies during the two-day event.

Some 3,000 candidate screenings were conducted.

Organised by Selangor Information Technology and Digital Economy Corporation (Sidec) and Malaysia Advanced Semiconductor & AI Academy, the event delivered unparalleled access to local brightest talents and the high-growth and high-paid semiconductor industry.

title: Infrastructure development, tax relief needed to boost cyber security — experts
summary: The development of stronger cyber security infrastructure as well as tax relief incentives for companies that invest in digital infrastructure are among aspects that the government is expected to focus on in Budget 2025.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Oct 6): The development of stronger cyber security infrastructure as well as tax relief incentives for companies that invest in digital infrastructure are among aspects that the government is expected to focus on in Budget 2025.

Experts in the field also believe that the government needs to strengthen digital literacy through basic curriculum in schools to ensure that the younger generation is proficient in using technology and understands the risks and threats in the cyber world.

title: Priotitise agritech investments under Budget 2025 to draw high-net-worth investors — economist
summary: Malaysia should prioritise investments in agricultural technology (agritech) in Budget 2025 to attract diverse investors, particularly family offices, said an economist.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Oct 6): Malaysia should prioritise investments in agricultural technology (agritech) in Budget 2025 to attract diverse investors, particularly family offices, said an economist.

UOB Kay Hian Wealth Advisors head of investment research Mohd Sedek Jantan said as the global population faces escalating climate change, rising food prices and increasing demand for sustainable food sources, agritech presents a crucial opportunity.

title: Household debt in good shape - Kenanga
summary: KUALA LUMPUR:  Kenanga Investment Bank Bhd (Kenanga Research) said household debt is in good shape, with June 2024’s debt-to-gross domestic product (GDP) ratio coming in at 83.8 per cent, reflecting sustained appetite of loans which is supported by higher income.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR:  Kenanga Investment Bank Bhd (Kenanga Research) said household debt is in good shape, with June 2024's debt-to-gross domestic product (GDP) ratio coming in at 83.8 per cent, reflecting sustained appetite of loans which is supported by higher income.

As at December 2023,  debt-to-GDP was 84.2 per cent.

Residential properties remain the lion's share of total debt (61.0 per cent) and would be largely collateralised, providing buffers to the financial system should there be a downturn.

title: Perkeso targets one million self-employed contributors by year-end
summary: SEREMBAN: The Social Security Organisation (Perkeso) is targeting one million contributors from the self-employed (OBS) by the end of this year.
content:
SEREMBAN: The Social Security Organisation (Perkeso) is targeting one million contributors from the self-employed (OBS) by the end of this year.

Perkeso chief communications and corporate affairs officer, Roshaimi Mat Rosely said there are 693,969 active self-employed contributors registered with Perkeso nationwide as of September 27.

"This shows the trend of increasing new contributors over time.

"The number of self-employed contributors is expected to continue to increase given that Self-Employment Social Security

title: Vietnam Q3 GDP grows 7.4 pct on robust exports, industrial production
summary: HANOI: Vietnam’s gross domestic product (GDP) grew 7.4 per cent year-on-year in the third quarter on the back of strong exports and industrial production, government data showed on Sunday.
content:
HANOI: Vietnam's gross domestic product (GDP) grew 7.4 per cent year-on-year in the third quarter on the back of strong exports and industrial production, government data showed on Sunday.

Consumer prices in September rose 2.63 per cent from a year earlier, the General Statistics Office said in a report.

Industrial production in the month rose 10.8 per cent and retail sales rose 7.6 per cent, it added.

Third-quarter GDP showed the highest quarterly expansion in two years, despite the impact of Typhoon Yagi whic

title: Labour talks to resume as Boeing strike enters 4th week
summary: NEW YORK: Talks are set to resume next week on a new labour contract covering some 33,000 striking Seattle-area Boeing employees, both sides said Friday.
content:
NEW YORK: Talks are set to resume next week on a new labour contract covering some 33,000 striking Seattle-area Boeing employees, both sides said Friday.

As the strike entered its fourth week, the union said the talks under a federal mediator would resume on Monday at 9:00 am, according to the website of the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers (IAM), District 751.

"This meeting is another critical opportunity to push for the priorities of our membership," the IAM said. "We will continue to fight

title: Trading on Bursa Malaysia likely to remain cautious next weeek
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Cautious trading is set to continue on Bursa Malaysia next week, driven by the bearish outlook on the global economy amid rising geopolitical tensions in the Middle East.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Cautious trading is set to continue on Bursa Malaysia next week, driven by the bearish outlook on the global economy amid rising geopolitical tensions in the Middle East.

Rakuten Trade Sdn Bhd equity research vice-president Thong Pak Leng said despite Hong Kong's Hang Seng continuing its upward trend, supported by optimism surrounding China's ongoing stimulus measures, most other emerging markets, including Malaysia, remained subdued, mirroring the cautious global mood.

title: Ringgit seen holding steady against US dollar next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is expected to linger around at 4.21 to 4.22 against the US dollar next week but with an upside bias for the greenback after Friday’s US non-farm payrolls (NFP) unexpectedly rose sharply by 254,000 jobs in September.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is expected to linger around at 4.21 to 4.22 against the US dollar next week but with an upside bias for the greenback after Friday's US non-farm payrolls (NFP) unexpectedly rose sharply by 254,000 jobs in September.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said the stronger-than-expected US jobs reading is likely to further enhance the appeal of the American dollar.

"The US Federal Reserve (Fed) may resort to a measured approach to monetary easing," he said,

title: Tastes and tribulations
summary: Many ingredients are vital for one to go far in F&B. Being accountable and responsible are two, says Upper Palace Dining Group founder Datuk Henry Yip, who learnt that the hard way.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Oct 6): Many ingredients are vital for one to go far in F&B. Being accountable and responsible are two, says Upper Palace Dining Group founder Datuk Henry Yip, who learnt that the hard way.

Time has dulled the cutting remarks he endured when he first stepped into a restaurant kitchen decades ago. Recounting them makes him laugh because the nicks have healed. What stays are lessons ingrained in him, from when he was with Sime Darby as a senior IT executive at the group’s hospitality and leisur

title: Adapting to the dynamic landscape of the real estate industry
summary: The October 7 issue of City & Country features an interview with the sibling duo spearheading the management of Titijaya Land Bhd.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Oct 6): The October 7 issue of City & Country features an interview with the sibling duo spearheading the management of Titijaya Land Bhd.

Since taking over the reins from their father and the company's founder Tan Sri Lim Soon Peng in 2021, Datuk Lim Poh Yit, group managing director, and his sister Charmaine, the group’s executive director, have been making strides in navigating the company amid the uncertain economic landscape caused by the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: To buy or to rent? That is the question
summary: Buying a home is typically the biggest and most complicated financial commitment we will ever make. And home ownership is a riskier proposition for households compared with renting.
content:
Street Sign Buy versus Rent

BUYING a home is typically the biggest and most complicated financial commitment we will ever make. And home ownership is a riskier proposition for households compared with renting.

Buyers take on enormous debts, sign multi-year loan agreements and become responsible for the cost of maintaining their homes. Renters, on the other hand, have to consider both market conditions and

title: Falling property prices - a boon for buyers
summary: Real estate prices are never easy to predict thanks to their periodically unexpected fluctuations. Once a shining example for South-East Asian property investors, Malaysia’s property market has seen its fair share of fluctuations these past years.
content:
Real estate prices are never easy to predict thanks to their periodically unexpected fluctuations. Once a shining example for South-East Asian property investors, Malaysia’s property market has seen its fair share of fluctuations these past years.

Some regions have shown a decline while others are continuing to thrive. Making informed decisions as an investor requires a thorough understanding of the factors driving such spikes

title: Grey neighbourhoods: fit for the ageing
summary: Malaysia’s population is beginning to age. Our South-East Asian nation is undoubtedly experiencing rapid ageing thanks to its growing segment of elderly individuals.
content:
Malaysia’s population is beginning to age. Our South-East Asian nation is undoubtedly experiencing rapid ageing thanks to its growing segment of elderly individuals.

This phenomenon is much more pronounced in urban areas, where younger people have migrated away in search of greener pastures in large cities or overseas. As such, these neighbourhoods have experienced a constant decline in their younger population, leaving behind
